Description: Limestone relief from the tomb of Ankhhef: two offering-bearers are represented in fair, sunk relief: the first carries a censer and is named Kʒpỉ; the second carries strips of linen and is called Wr(?)-Ḥ‘py.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: B. Porter & R. Moss, 'Topographical Bibliography of Ancient Egyptian Hieroglyphic Texts, Reliefs and Paintings' III (Oxford: Clarendon Press), 66; Part 2, 306.
Bibliographic references: James 1961 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc. Part 1 (pl.15)
